intro: Fitzgeraldia forrestii, commonly known as the Forrester's Fitzgeraldia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family, Asteraceae, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty air. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Fitzgeraldia forrestii is considered a rare and endemic species, found primarily in the North Island of New Zealand.
